name.namePart: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio

originInfo.publisher: Administrative Office of the United States Courts

titleInfo.title: Sabatine v. Paul Revere Life Insurance Company

name.namePart: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio

titleInfo.title: Sabatine v. Paul Revere Life Insurance Company
titleInfo.subTitle: Memorandum Opinion and Order that Sabatine's motion for partial summary judgment (ECF No. 50) is Denied and Paul Revere's motion for summary judgment (ECF No. 48) is Denied in part (Count One and Two) and Granted in part (Count Three). Thus, this case shall proceed solely on Count One and Count Two. Further, Sabatine's motion for partial summary judgment with respect to future damages (ECF No. 49) is Denied. Paul Revere's motion to exclude the testimony of Mary E. Fuller as a bad faith expert (ECF No. 67) is Denied at Moot. Sabatine's motion seeking the admissibility of documents Paul Revere turned over during discovery, but is now claiming the documents are privileged (ECF No. 71) is Denied as Moot. Because the Court has denied as moot Sabatine's motion to admit the documents, Paul Revere's motion (ECF No. 72) is likewise Denied as Moot with permission to re-file as necessary. Because the Court has denied as moot Paul Reveres motion to exclude the testimony of Mary E. Fuller as a bad faith expert, Paul Revere's motion to strike or alternatively, sur-reply to Sabatine's sur-response in opposition to motion to exclude proposed expert testimony of Mary E. Fuller (ECF No. 87) is likewise Denied as Moot. Counsel are directed to separately prepare and file with the Court comprehensive substantive jury instructions for each and every claim by plaintiffs, along with accompanying interrogatories that are keyed to the instructions, by April 15, 2011. The Court will conduct a status conference in this case on May 3, 2011, at 12:30 pm in Chambers 402 for the purpose of scheduling a trial date. Signed by Judge David D. Dowd, Jr. on 1/14/2011. (M,De)

Sabatine's motion seeking the admissibility of documents Paul Revere turned over during discovery, but is now claiming the documents are privileged (ECF No. 71) is Denied as Moot.
